posts.title: NY county clerk refuses to file Texas' fine for doctor accused of prescribing abortion pills
top_comments:
And this sets up the fight they're looking for over NY's shield law, as well as whether they can punish someone in another state that engaged in behavior based in and legal in that state.

If they win that fight it will be a disaster, but particularly for trans health care and abortion in the short term.

>“New York is shredding the Constitution to hide lawbreakers from justice, and it must end,” Paxton said on X. 

Oh, New York is the one shredding the constitution, is it?
Wait, didn't they try this shit with the fugitive slave act? Wasn't there a war sometime after that?
Ken Paxton is a crook who used his position as Texas AG to evade securities fraud charges.
Well kudos to this person. Putting your job on the line for your principles is courageous. America is going to need a lot more of this.

Just wait till Texas has a snatch squad or “bounty hunter” grab her and bring to Texas. Sure it would be illegal, but who’s going to stop them these days.? I’m sure a New York judge would issue an order for her to be brought back, which would swiftly be ignored.

>Republican Texas State Attorney General Ken Paxton said he was outraged by the refusal and signaled he would take action.

Funny, you don't seem to mind it when Trump ignores a court ruling.  And the ones he's ignoring are even valid!

That county clerk is a hero.

posts.title: Exclusive: FDA staff struggle to meet product review deadlines after DOGE layoffs
top_comments:
This isn't a bug, it's a feature.

1. Fire all the staff so they can't get their reviews and approvals done in a timely manner.  
2. Publicly complain that the FDA approvals are taking too long and regulations are too onerous.  
3. Remove regulations.
3500 FDA employees will be laid off. This is in addition to those already let go

Going back to when America was great and milk producers put formaldehyde in milk to extend the shelf life. Before the FDA all we could do was to plead with the companies to please stop killing kids.

https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/19th-century-fight-bacteria-ridden-milk-embalming-fluid-180970473/

I am a medical device auditor.  I can remember a time when a [483](https://www.fda.gov/inspections-compliance-enforcement-and-criminal-investigations/inspection-references/fda-form-483-frequently-asked-questions) was something to be feared by corporate executives.  Defending companies from the FDA was a career path. Now, it's barely even heard of.

The FDA was barely surviving as it was.  They were a good organization that [helped a lot of people](https://www.fda.gov/about-fda/fda-history-exhibits/frances-oldham-kelsey-medical-reviewer-famous-averting-public-health-tragedy).  But medical devices and especially pharmaceuticals went the way of Boeing back in [2017](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_Order_13771).  With his [newest deregulation efforts](https://www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2025/01/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-launches-massive-10-to-1-deregulation-initiative/#:~:text=In%20his%20first%20term%2C%20President,for%20everyone%20new%20regulation%20issued.), it really is gone.  This is just another nail in the coffin.  Hopefully we can rebuild someday.

1. Break government

2. Claim government doesn't work

3. Abandon regulatory agencies, privatize program administration.

Enjoy Russia-West.

Think about it this way......

A health inspector isn't necessarily efficient for a business. But we need them to maintain food safety. It's not fraud, it's not a Kabal of deep state food molesters. It's a necessary protection. 

But if everything is looked at through the lens of business and not country. Well, the health inspector can be made to look "fraudulent".

I work at a medical device manufacturer and the documentation and safety guidelines are all targeted at FDA requirements. Audits at the facility are a huge deal, and any pushback on following process gets over ridden because the consequences of a failed audit are not worth the risk. I don't think most companies are going to backslide on purpose but when the watchdog isn't there it becomes much much easier.
The plan to Make America Shittier is working.
Get ready for more food borne illness!
I really hate republicans.

posts.title: Yale professor who studies fascism fleeing US to work in Canada
top_comments:
"Out here, nobody knows where I am, and I’m believed to be away on a trip. Here are brewing economically and politically dark times, so I’m happy to be able to get away from everything." 

-Einstein hiding in Northern Germany in 1922, eleven years before he renounced his German citizenship following Hitlers rise to chancellor.

The vast majority of U.S. residents cannot leave. They either lack the resources or no one would be willing to take them on due to factors such as age, education, and others reasons. Protected is our freedom to travel, and essentially to leave has been our right. However, with a passport costing $250 and roughly 60% of Americans being a single paycheck away from homelessness, the majority have no freedom to travel or leave.  Trickle-down only worked for billionaires. The middle class has been significantly eroded over the past few decades. We are now stuck with our makings.

A poignant quote from the article:  "Social media posts spread on Wednesday, noting the alarm sounded by a scholar of fascism leaving the country over its political climate. Nikole Hannah-Jones, the journalist and creator of the 1619 Project,[wrote](https://bsky.app/profile/nhannahjones.bsky.social/post/3llakwvszts2c) on the social media platform Bluesky: “When scholars of authoritarianism and fascism leave US universities because of the deteriorating political situation here, we should really worry.”
He'll be back when he has to do his fieldwork.

I use his video to teach my G10 students about fascism (I teach history at an American school in Taipei, Taiwan). The Trump Administration has ticked just about every single box he listed. 

Here's the video if you haven't seen it: https://youtu.be/CpCKkWMbmXU?si=NaQGVkXHwpxsENZE
If only there had been a literal decade of warnings for people to pay attention to…

"Those who do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it"

This is simply an example of the inverse being true.

Professor here at a large American university that has been named as one of the 60 targets of the administration for whatever bullshit they don't like. Most of us cannot leave. Many of us are staying and fighting in whatever ways we can. They may come for all of us who are politically outspoken eventually. While Stanley is doing what is best for him, I am proud of my colleagues staying and resisting right now. Still, I am really, really scared -- especially for our international students and colleagues.
Fleeing from Germany to France vibes.
We're hostages tied to a chair while children with loaded guns are running around.  I hate it here

posts.title: Amazon Is Canceling a Major Alexa Privacy Feature on March 28: Should You Worry?
top_comments: Almost amazing how the service industry has become more about consumers servicing companies than companies serving customers.

From the article: 
"As Amazon readies the huge AI upgrade to Alexa called Alexa Plus, the retail juggernaut has revealed a disturbing change in its privacy policies. Beginning on March 28th, users of Echo smart speakers and Echo Show displays won't be able to block their devices from sending all voice recordings to Amazon for analysis.


Keeping voice recordings local is an important privacy feature for any voice assistant, and removing it raises serious questions about what Amazon is listening to. And even if you didn't know about these privacy settings before, I bet you're worried about voice assistant privacy in general: Our CNET Survey found over 70% of people have privacy concerns about adding more AI to home voice assistants -- and now we're seeing those fears in action."

*Starting March 28, Amazon will be removing the "Do not send voice recordings" option, which means all recorded voice commands will be automatically sent to Amazon for processing and analysis.*

This is utterly outrageous.  And should be absolutely illegal.

Does it not somehow manage to run afoul of any anti-wire tapping laws? Seems like it would. 

Guests in your home did not sign the agreement for both party consent states. 

Or would it only be the device owner in trouble and not Amazon?

I use mine to turn on a couple of lights and for alarms. I guess I'll need to find another solution. It now makes zero sense to invest in anyone's ecosphere. You get everything setup, it does what you want, they change the terms of service, and it no longer does what you want.
I'm worried shitless, constantly, every single day. This changes nothing.
I don’t trust Siri or Alexa.

I’m not worried. Every time Alexa would come on when it heard its name on my television and tried to communicate, I shut her down. Now Alexa lives in a drawer in my closet with a charging cable wrapped around her neck.
That cunt and her friend hey Google are never allowed in my house.
No. Because I didn't let Alexa in my house to begin with. Fuck bezos.

posts.title: US honeybee deaths hit record high as scientists scramble to find main cause
top_comments: Stop using weed killer. It's toxic to them and destroys their main food sources.
Half of America thinking climate change and environmental science is woke might have something to do with it.
Well there’s the whole saturate the country in pesticides and glyphosate to start…

> Commercial beekeepers have reported losing more than 60% of their colonies, on average, over the winter, according to an ongoing Project Apis m. survey that covers more than two-thirds of America’s managed bees.

The average winter loss used to be 10-20% until colony collapse began. They pollinate half our crops. This should freak everyone out.
neonicitinoids by agra biotech firms for crop pesticides- banned elsewhere, not in usa.

Nothing will change without strict regulations on pesticides. It's not just agriculture sterilizing the countryside. Any idiot with a credit card can buy a barrel of poison and sterilize not just their yard but everything downwind and downstream of it for miles. 

We thought we fixed everything by banning DDT, but that first Silent Spring was just the beginning. We're about to lose even more birds and wildlife in our world as insect populations continue to collapse.
It's us. "Us" is the main cause

We live in the city, we have a nice backyard garden, we don't use any pesticides, weed killers, bottled nutrients, etc for approximately 14 years. The bees have made a home here. Every year when they swarm its seems another groups attempts to set up camp here. I do believe they can tell when you don't use harmful chemicals around your property
Scientists aren't scrambling to find the main cause, the people just don't like the answer.
People dousing their lawns in chemicals every year to kill dandelions which are one of the earliest sources of food in the spring for honey bees. All for the vanity lawn.

The west coast and New England made America wealthy and influential. Now jealous spiteful backwater and flyover states want to punish us relentlessly for tolerating LGBTQ people and being sane and secular. 

Eventually the question will be why the fuck are we still in this union? We get nothing but grief from it. The president they assign to lord over us just wants to hurt and insult us. Our tax dollars go out to them but we get nothing but insane policy and punishment.

When the cost of existing in this union exceeds the benefit by such an enormous amount people will start looking for the door. Fighting for freedom is often preferable to suffering forever.
Time for Cali to become independent and create a new government, something like a Republic, call it the "New California Republic", yeah, sounds nice, NCR for short.

posts.title: Amazon Is Canceling a Major Alexa Privacy Feature on March 28: Should You Worry?
top_comments: Almost amazing how the service industry has become more about consumers servicing companies than companies serving customers.

From the article: 
"As Amazon readies the huge AI upgrade to Alexa called Alexa Plus, the retail juggernaut has revealed a disturbing change in its privacy policies. Beginning on March 28th, users of Echo smart speakers and Echo Show displays won't be able to block their devices from sending all voice recordings to Amazon for analysis.


Keeping voice recordings local is an important privacy feature for any voice assistant, and removing it raises serious questions about what Amazon is listening to. And even if you didn't know about these privacy settings before, I bet you're worried about voice assistant privacy in general: Our CNET Survey found over 70% of people have privacy concerns about adding more AI to home voice assistants -- and now we're seeing those fears in action."

*Starting March 28, Amazon will be removing the "Do not send voice recordings" option, which means all recorded voice commands will be automatically sent to Amazon for processing and analysis.*

This is utterly outrageous.  And should be absolutely illegal.

Does it not somehow manage to run afoul of any anti-wire tapping laws? Seems like it would. 

Guests in your home did not sign the agreement for both party consent states. 

Or would it only be the device owner in trouble and not Amazon?

I use mine to turn on a couple of lights and for alarms. I guess I'll need to find another solution. It now makes zero sense to invest in anyone's ecosphere. You get everything setup, it does what you want, they change the terms of service, and it no longer does what you want.
I'm worried shitless, constantly, every single day. This changes nothing.
I don’t trust Siri or Alexa.

I’m not worried. Every time Alexa would come on when it heard its name on my television and tried to communicate, I shut her down. Now Alexa lives in a drawer in my closet with a charging cable wrapped around her neck.
That cunt and her friend hey Google are never allowed in my house.

posts.title: Amazon Is Canceling a Major Alexa Privacy Feature on March 28: Should You Worry?
top_comments: Almost amazing how the service industry has become more about consumers servicing companies than companies serving customers.

From the article: 
"As Amazon readies the huge AI upgrade to Alexa called Alexa Plus, the retail juggernaut has revealed a disturbing change in its privacy policies. Beginning on March 28th, users of Echo smart speakers and Echo Show displays won't be able to block their devices from sending all voice recordings to Amazon for analysis.


Keeping voice recordings local is an important privacy feature for any voice assistant, and removing it raises serious questions about what Amazon is listening to. And even if you didn't know about these privacy settings before, I bet you're worried about voice assistant privacy in general: Our CNET Survey found over 70% of people have privacy concerns about adding more AI to home voice assistants -- and now we're seeing those fears in action."

*Starting March 28, Amazon will be removing the "Do not send voice recordings" option, which means all recorded voice commands will be automatically sent to Amazon for processing and analysis.*

This is utterly outrageous.  And should be absolutely illegal.

Does it not somehow manage to run afoul of any anti-wire tapping laws? Seems like it would. 

Guests in your home did not sign the agreement for both party consent states. 

Or would it only be the device owner in trouble and not Amazon?

I use mine to turn on a couple of lights and for alarms. I guess I'll need to find another solution. It now makes zero sense to invest in anyone's ecosphere. You get everything setup, it does what you want, they change the terms of service, and it no longer does what you want.
I'm worried shitless, constantly, every single day. This changes nothing.
I don’t trust Siri or Alexa.

I’m not worried. Every time Alexa would come on when it heard its name on my television and tried to communicate, I shut her down. Now Alexa lives in a drawer in my closet with a charging cable wrapped around her neck.
That cunt and her friend hey Google are never allowed in my house.
No. Because I didn't let Alexa in my house to begin with. Fuck bezos.

If they win that fight it will be a disaster, but particularly for trans health care and abortion in the short term.

>“New York is shredding the Constitution to hide lawbreakers from justice, and it must end,” Paxton said on X. 

Oh, New York is the one shredding the constitution, is it?
Wait, didn't they try this shit with the fugitive slave act? Wasn't there a war sometime after that?
Ken Paxton is a crook who used his position as Texas AG to evade securities fraud charges.
Well kudos to this person. Putting your job on the line for your principles is courageous. America is going to need a lot more of this.

Just wait till Texas has a snatch squad or “bounty hunter” grab her and bring to Texas. Sure it would be illegal, but who’s going to stop them these days.? I’m sure a New York judge would issue an order for her to be brought back, which would swiftly be ignored.

>Republican Texas State Attorney General Ken Paxton said he was outraged by the refusal and signaled he would take action.

Funny, you don't seem to mind it when Trump ignores a court ruling.  And the ones he's ignoring are even valid!
Ken Paxton should be in jail.
Good on them, fuck Texas!
That county clerk is a hero.

posts.title: Exclusive: FDA staff struggle to meet product review deadlines after DOGE layoffs
top_comments:
This isn't a bug, it's a feature.

1. Fire all the staff so they can't get their reviews and approvals done in a timely manner.  
2. Publicly complain that the FDA approvals are taking too long and regulations are too onerous.  
3. Remove regulations.
3500 FDA employees will be laid off. This is in addition to those already let go

Going back to when America was great and milk producers put formaldehyde in milk to extend the shelf life. Before the FDA all we could do was to plead with the companies to please stop killing kids.

https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/19th-century-fight-bacteria-ridden-milk-embalming-fluid-180970473/

I am a medical device auditor.  I can remember a time when a [483](https://www.fda.gov/inspections-compliance-enforcement-and-criminal-investigations/inspection-references/fda-form-483-frequently-asked-questions) was something to be feared by corporate executives.  Defending companies from the FDA was a career path. Now, it's barely even heard of.

The FDA was barely surviving as it was.  They were a good organization that [helped a lot of people](https://www.fda.gov/about-fda/fda-history-exhibits/frances-oldham-kelsey-medical-reviewer-famous-averting-public-health-tragedy).  But medical devices and especially pharmaceuticals went the way of Boeing back in [2017](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_Order_13771).  With his [newest deregulation efforts](https://www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2025/01/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-launches-massive-10-to-1-deregulation-initiative/#:~:text=In%20his%20first%20term%2C%20President,for%20everyone%20new%20regulation%20issued.), it really is gone.  This is just another nail in the coffin.  Hopefully we can rebuild someday.

1. Break government

2. Claim government doesn't work

3. Abandon regulatory agencies, privatize program administration.

Enjoy Russia-West.

Think about it this way......

A health inspector isn't necessarily efficient for a business. But we need them to maintain food safety. It's not fraud, it's not a Kabal of deep state food molesters. It's a necessary protection. 

But if everything is looked at through the lens of business and not country. Well, the health inspector can be made to look "fraudulent".

I work at a medical device manufacturer and the documentation and safety guidelines are all targeted at FDA requirements. Audits at the facility are a huge deal, and any pushback on following process gets over ridden because the consequences of a failed audit are not worth the risk. I don't think most companies are going to backslide on purpose but when the watchdog isn't there it becomes much much easier.
The plan to Make America Shittier is working.
Get ready for more food borne illness!
I really hate republicans.
